intro: Monteverdia zakii, commonly known as the Sierra Madre mistplant, is a rare and endemic species found in the cloud forests of the Sierra Madre mountains in Mexico. It is a small, evergreen shrub characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that help retain moisture in its humid, misty habitat. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Its unique adaptations to high-altitude conditions make it a subject of interest for botanists studying plant resilience. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, Monteverdia zakii is considered a vulnerable species.
